howItWorksSubtitle: A simple, three-step process to get you the help you need.
step1Description: Use our Smart Triage tool to tell us how you're feeling. You can also upload images for a more accurate analysis.
step2Description: Our intelligent system analyzes your information and provides a preliminary triage recommendation and suggests relevant specialists.
step3Description: Based on the recommendation, book an appointment, read health tips, or manage your health data all in one place.
smartTriageSubtitle: Describe your symptoms to get an AI-powered triage recommendation.
provideDetailsDescription: Provide as much detail as possible for a more accurate analysis.
symptomsPlaceholder: e.g., I have a sharp pain in my chest, and I'm feeling dizzy...
loginToContinue: You must be logged in to get a recommendation.
aiRecommendationSubtitle: The AI-powered triage analysis will appear below.
recommendationPlaceholder: Your triage recommendation will appear here.
aboutSubtitle: An intelligent, simplified platform for personal health management, designed with transparency and cutting-edge technology.
aboutHowItWorksSubtitle: A detailed look at your journey from symptom to solution.
aboutHowItWorksStep1Desc: Start by using our intuitive 'Smart Triage' tool. Describe your symptoms in natural language. For a more comprehensive analysis, you can upload an image of the affected area (like a skin rash) or a recent medical report (PDF or image). Our system is designed to understand and process this multi-modal information securely.
aboutHowItWorksStep2Desc: Once you submit your information, our AI engine, powered by Google's Gemini model, gets to work. It analyzes the text, image, and report data to generate a preliminary triage recommendation. This includes a severity level (e.g., Mild, Moderate, Severe), a suggested course of action, a concise summary of the findings, and a list of relevant doctor specialties.
aboutHowItWorksStep3Desc: With your recommendation in hand, you are empowered to take the next step. If our AI suggests seeing a specialist, you can use the 'Book Appointment' feature to find and schedule a visit directly. You can also explore our 'Health Tips Dashboard' for general advice or test your knowledge with a 'Health Quiz'. All your activities are securely saved in the 'Your Data' section for future reference.
aboutCoreFeaturesSubtitle: A closer look at the tools designed to empower your health decisions.
aboutFeatureSmartTriageDesc: An AI-powered symptom checker that analyzes text, images, and medical reports to provide instant triage recommendations. Includes a special Ayurveda mode for alternative insights.
aboutFeatureReportReaderDesc: Securely upload your medical reports (PDFs or images), and our AI will extract and summarize the key findings, making complex documents easy to understand.
aboutFeatureBookAppointmentDesc: Seamlessly schedule appointments with specialists. The system can even pre-select a doctor based on your triage results.
aboutFeatureYourDataDesc: A secure, centralized dashboard to view your past triage results, report analyses, quiz scores, and upcoming appointments. You can export your data at any time.
aboutFeatureHealthTipsDesc: Access a curated library of health tips to stay informed and test your knowledge with interactive quizzes on various health topics.
ourTechnologySubtitle: Built on a foundation of modern, secure, and scalable technologies.
techNextJs: For a fast, server-rendered React application.
techReact: For building a robust and type-safe user interface.
techTailwind: For modern, accessible, and aesthetically pleasing component styling.
techFirebase: For secure user authentication and a scalable NoSQL Firestore database.
techGenkit: Google's latest generative AI model and framework, powering all intelligent features.
techAppHosting: For continuous deployment and scalable, secure hosting.

healthTipsDashboardSubtitle: Common health and safety questions, answered for you.
tip1Question: How much water should I drink daily?
tip1Answer: The common recommendation is to drink eight 8-ounce glasses, which equals about 2 liters, or half a gallon. This is called the 8Ã—8 rule and is easy to remember. However, needs can vary based on activity level, climate, and overall health.
tip2Question: What are the benefits of regular exercise?
tip2Answer: Regular physical activity can improve your muscle strength and boost your endurance. Exercise delivers oxygen and nutrients to your tissues and helps your cardiovascular system work more efficiently. And when your heart and lung health improve, you have more energy to tackle daily chores.
tip3Question: How much sleep do I need?
tip3Answer: Most adults need 7 to 9 hours of sleep per night. Children and teens need more. The right amount of sleep helps you feel rested and ready for the day. It's crucial for mental and physical health, quality of life, and safety.
tip4Question: Is it important to eat breakfast?
tip4Answer: Breakfast is often called 'the most important meal of the day', and for good reason. As the name suggests, breakfast breaks the overnight fasting period. It replenishes your supply of glucose to boost your energy levels and alertness, while also providing other essential nutrients required for good health.
tip5Answer: A balanced diet is a diet that contains differing kinds of foods in certain quantities and proportions so that the requirement for calories, proteins, minerals, vitamins and alternative nutrients is adequate and a small provision is reserved for additional nutrients to endure the short length of leanness.
resetPasswordSubtitle: Enter your email and we'll send you a link to get back into your account.

passwordResetFailed: Failed to send password reset email.
healthQuizSubtitle: Test your health-savvy with these quick questions.
question: Question
quizResultsSavedDesc: Your score has been saved to your activity log.
quizQ1: Which of the following is a primary source of Vitamin D?
quizQ1Explanation: The body produces Vitamin D when skin is directly exposed to the sun. That's why it's often called the 'sunshine vitamin'.
quizQ2: How many minutes of moderate aerobic activity is recommended per week for adults?
quizQ2Explanation: For substantial health benefits, adults should do at least 150 minutes (2 hours and 30 minutes) a week of moderate-intensity aerobic activity.
quizQ3: Which food is the best source of omega-3 fatty acids?
quizQ3Explanation: Fatty fish like salmon, mackerel, and herring are excellent sources of omega-3 fatty acids, which are crucial for brain health.
quizQ4: What does 'REM' stand for in the context of sleep?
quizQ4Options: Rapid Energy Movement,Restful Easy Moments,Rapid Eye Movement,Rest, Energize, Motivate
quizQ4Explanation: REM sleep is a stage of sleep characterized by the rapid and random movement of the eyes. It is the stage where most dreaming occurs.
quizQ5: Dehydration occurs when your body loses more ______ than it takes in.
quizQ5Explanation: Dehydration happens when your body doesn't have as much water as it needs. Without enough, your body can't function properly.
